comment.body:
> [sigsegv](#comment_1_1LmxVpbqhEn3ZGVp4bfmmPogMhCqRDePpv): I think Zeronat and Ethereum can complete each other. Running an organisazation is dealing with rules. While it seems possible to decide regulations using zeronet, I don't see a way enforcing rules with zeronet. Providing such a possibility is the true inovation of ethereum.

by definition zeronet itself and every page on it can already be considered a dao. since taking down the creators server has zero effect and they can run any scripts you can write aka smart contracts. all you need is to make a sites code audit-able im sure that isnt hard
i dont think the internet is big enough for eth, i think eth is just a very, very well crafted ponzi scheme
